title: Arsene Wenger is an analogue manager in a digital age and could massively damage Arsenal if he stays on
text:
Sport Opinion Arsene Wenger is an analogue manager in a digital age and could massively damage Arsenal if he stays on Stan Collymore believes that by keeping Wenger, the Gunners will miss out on a top-level replacement Share Wenger has promised to reveal his future plans soon (Photo: AFP) Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
If Arsene Wenger does stay on at Arsenal it could be massively damaging for the club. 
One big problem could be the managers they miss out on by not making a change now. 
There are a lot of managers that would walk to Arsenal . For the next man, it is all laid there in front of him. 
The club is in a world famous city, attracts 60,000 fans to matches, is a huge revenue generator, has lots of cash in the bank and a fine domestic history. 
But if you are the likes of Diego Simeone, Thomas Tuchel , Jorge Sampaoli, Max Allegri you would think ‘if Wenger is going to stay for another two or three years, in that time the Bayern Munich job might come up. Or the jobs at Chelsea, Liverpool or perhaps even Manchester United.’ The Wenger Out brigade are in full voice at the moment (Photo: AFP) 
All clubs with much better pedigree than Arsenal domestically and in Europe. 
Surely Arsenal’s owner Stan Kroenke can see that not only are there managers out there like Jose Mourinho, Antonio Conte, Sampaoli, Allegri, Jurgen Klopp and Pep Guardiola who are winning trophies but they are also younger and fresher. 
Wenger is now an analogue manager in a digital age. 
If anybody thinks Wenger is winning the Champions League next season or the league in the next couple of seasons they are deluded. 
When I look at Arsenal’s situation now I have to detach myself from everything I’ve ever written and every caveat such as Wenger is a lovely bloke and he brought us the Invincibles. 
When I look at what is presented in front of me I see a manager who has not won a top level title in over a decade. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Arsene Wenger speaks after Arsenal lose 3-1 at West Brom Share this video Watch Next 
A manager that is presiding over a style of play that is lightweight, easy on the eye and good against 50–70 per cent of teams in the Premier League but increasingly isn’t competitive against the best. 
A manager that has been overtaken by four or five other managers in the league that are fresher, younger and have better track records in terms of winning. For me it is quite simple. He has to go. 
What Arsenal need now to answer all the criticism from fans and pundits is bottle, grit, determination and leadership. Simeone has all those things and is what Arsenal need. 
He earns around half of the £8m-a-year Wenger gets and has managed to break up Barcelona and Real Madrid’s dominance in Spain, get into Champions League finals while having to sell his best players every couple of years. 
If they were to bring in Simeone the question I’d have for anyone pro-Wenger is would you be more or less confident of Simeone buying winners, better players, shaking up the existing squad and the two world class players at the club? Diego Simeone would be a great fit at the Emirates (Photo: AFP) 
The answer is surely you would be more confident. 
It also has to be said that in terms of how the club is run, Stan Kroenke is an absolute disgrace. He obviously doesn’t care about being competitive in the Premier League or Champions League. 
What he cares about is keeping the tills ringing, making Arsenal a business that is in the black and making sure their asset is worth more in years to come. 
That has bred a group of people that run the club led by Kroenke but also with Wenger in it that are happy to just do the bare minimum while deluding their fans into thinking they will win something big. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
